intro: Sisymbrium perenne, commonly known as field pennycress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has pinnately lobed leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Botanically, it belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants.
